title: American_Top_40_1988_February_20th
description:
"On American Top 40, I'm Casey Kasem count'em down, and the hits don't stop till we reach the top."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey says it was Dee Snyder of Twisted Sister who came to name Taylor Dane whose song "Tell It To My Heart" is at number 39.

A listener wants to know what number one song has had the longest title. Casey says it was a long song title about a small bathing suit.

Casey tells about groups of people changing their phone number from "835-5937" (Squeeze's hit at number 33) because of all the calls they started getting. Then he tells about a business that also has that number so couldn't change it but got creative instead. 

"Stand By Me" (by Ben E. King) previously held a record for most remakes into a single, having been remade six times (Casey plays a piece of each). Another song in this countdown just tied that record.

There is a song whose origins began when the writer was in kindergarten.

Casey answers the question, "When were there the most remakes in the top 40?" Casey says in November of 1970 there were eight remakes in his countdown.
